      • restart

        public void restart()
        reinitialise the whole database with the opening SQL queries and the user data assumes the connection is already open

      • loadDatabase

        public void loadDatabase(java.lang.String dataFileDirectory)
        load a new database from a specified location
        Parameters:
        dataFileDirectory - the full path to the directory in which the data files are located. If in NIX format (with '\' instead of '/') this is converted to Windows format.

      • openDatabase

        private void openDatabase()
        create the connection and execute the initialization file

      • copyDataFilesToUserDirectory

        public void copyDataFilesToUserDirectory(java.lang.String basePath,
                                         java.lang.String subDirectory,
                                         java.lang.String resource)
        copy a file from the .jar file into the user file system. The base directory for these files in the user system is Utilities.userBasePath and is set there statically for example copyDataFilesToUserDirectory("/data","useValues.csv") copies the file called useValues.csv to the location Documents/Capsim/data/useValues.csv, because the user base is initialised in Utilities to be Documents/Capsim
        Parameters:
        subDirectory - the sub-directory of our standard location into which the file should be copied
        resource - the file name of the resource, with no path
        basePath - the absolute path to the main directory in which subDirectory is to be found

      • exportDataFiles

        public void exportDataFiles()
        copy all the data files into a standardised directory in the user's file system. This is the easiest and most robust way to work around all the difficulties associated with accessing data files in an exported .jar file

      • initialiseDataBaseAndStart

        public void initialiseDataBaseAndStart()

      • saveDataBase

        public void saveDataBase(java.io.File saveDirectory)
        save the database, in its current state, to a directory as a set of CSV files
        Parameters:
        saveDirectory - the directory in which to save the files

      • saveOneTable

        public void saveOneTable(java.lang.String baseDirectory,
                         java.lang.String tableName)
        save one table
        Parameters:
        baseDirectory - the folder into which the table will be saved
        tableName - the name of the table to save, which will also be the name of the .csv file
